page.title: 12Fetcham Area Farms cont.
page.content: {Randalls Park Farm}is now a private house of the Tudor / Victorian period.{Manor Farm}is a farm cottage for Slyfield Farm. {Barracks Farm}is still in working order. Mr. Gunther, the owner thinks that the farm is named so because Cromwell is said to have stabled his horses there. One of the rooms is kept at a temperature of 80 degrees F, this is where the turkey chicks are kept within a large cardboard ring. A calor gas lamp keeps the temperature at 115 degrees F above them. At six weeks part of their top beak is removed to stop them pecking each other. They eat high protein food costing Â£200 a ton. By 11 weeks the males are developing a flap of red skin. The turkeys are now being fed a mixture of grain, chemicals and fishmeal by an automatic feeder.
